page.title: 05ST. MATTHEWS CHURCH
page.content: Salford Priors church was built in the twelfth century.It has a beautiful Norman doorway.There is a fine 15th century Flamboyant window and three late Norman arches.There are three monuments to Sir Simon Clarke's family. Outside the church are some gargoyles and two towers,a main tower with a clock which is floodlit at night and a beacon tower.There is a graveyard.The church has a peal of eight bells.The vicar lives in the vicarage near the church.There are two church wardens and a Parochial Church Council connected with the church. There are bellringers who ring hand bells too,a choir,a Mothers Union,Mens Fellowship and a Childrens Church.80 people are on the electoral roll representing 50 families.The church uses a room next to Kenly Cottage for its meetings.
